user.title: Configure Alternative Time Systems
user.description: Select the time systems you want to display.

data.name: Instance name
data.enable_nato_zone: Enable NATO Time with Zone Indicator

data_description.name: A unique name for this configuration
data_description.enable_timezone: Shows current time in a selected timezone (e.g., 14:30:45 CEST)
data_description.enable_stardate: Star Trek TNG stardate (e.g., 47634.44). Based on year 2323
data_description.enable_swatch: Internet time in beats @000-@999. One day = 1000 beats, no timezones
data_description.enable_unix: Seconds since Jan 1, 1970 00:00 UTC (e.g., 1735689600). IT standard
data_description.enable_decimal: French Revolutionary time: 10 hours, 100 minutes, 100 seconds per day
data_description.enable_hexadecimal: Day divided into 65536 parts, displayed in hex (e.g., .8000 = noon)
data_description.enable_maya: Long Count, Tzolk'in and Haab calendar (e.g., 13.0.12.1.15 | 8 Ahau | 3 Pop)
data_description.enable_nato_zone: Full military DTG: DDHHMM[Zone] MON YY (e.g., 151430Z JAN 25)
data_description.enable_nato_rescue: German rescue service notation: DD HHMM MONTH YY (e.g., 15 1430 JAN 25)
data_description.enable_attic: Ancient Athenian lunisolar calendar with Archon and Olympiad (e.g., 5 histamenou Hekatombaion)
data_description.enable_suriyakati: Thai calendar with Buddhist Era, BE = CE+543 (e.g., 2568 BE)
data_description.enable_darian: Mars calendar with 24 months and 668 sols per year (e.g., 15 Gemini 217)

error.no_time_system_selected: Please select at least one time system.
